TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SemaphoreSlim extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

remarks.para: The provides a lightweight semaphore class that doesn't use Windows kernel semaphores.

summary.para: A lightweight alternative to that limits the number of threads that can access a resource or pool of resources concurrently.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the initial number of requests that can be granted concurrently.

Docs.param: The initial number of requests for the semaphore that can be granted concurrently.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the initial and maximum number of requests that can be granted concurrently.

Docs.param: The initial number of requests for the semaphore that can be granted concurrently.
The maximum number of requests for the semaphore that can be granted concurrently.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.WaitHandle AvailableWaitHandle { get; }
.property instance class System.Threading.WaitHandle AvailableWaitHandle

remarks.para: Use this property only when you must wait on a SemaphoreSlim together with other kernel-based synchronization objects with the same wait handle. A successful wait on the does not imply a successful wait on the itself, nor does it decrement the semaphore's count. After the available wait handle is signaled, you should wait on the specifically.

summary.para: Returns a that can be used to wait on the semaphore.

MemberSignature.Value: public int CurrentCount { get; }
.property instance int32 CurrentCount

summary.para: Gets the number of threads that will be allowed to enter the .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Dispose ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose() cil managed

remarks.para: Call Dispose when you are finished using the . The Dispose method leaves the in an unusable state. After calling Dispose, you must release all references to the so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the was occupying.
For more information, see Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources and Implementing a Dispose Method.

block.para: Always call Dispose before you release your last reference to the . Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the object's Finalize method.

summary.para: Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed

remarks.para: Unlike most of the members of , is not thread-safe and may not be used concurrently with other members of this instance.

summary.para: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the , and optionally releases the managed resources.

Docs.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.
